pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:0.5: 58. The training rule on holding a staff
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a staff. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.3: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.6: What is longer than that is not a staff, nor what is shorter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.7: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.8: If a monk out of disrespect gives a teaching to someone holding a staff who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.12: The eighth training rule is finished.
